results.title: Heavy petting
results.brief_description: Using footage from Hollywood in the 50’s and 60’s and educational material from the era, known personalities reflect on what it was like to be a living, breathing, sexual being in the 1950’s or 60’s. People such as Allan Ginsberg, William Burroughs, Sandra Bernhard, Francis Fisher, Frederic Lahey, John Oates and Zoe Tamerlaine discuss issues such as; dating, masturbation, petting, falling in love, menstruation, things you did to look cool, cruising, parties, dances, teen pregnancy, STD, and all the other concerns surrounding being a teenager. Set to a soundtrack of music from the decades in question, this snappy and entertaining documentary presents the viewer with a slice of 50’s and 60’s nostalgia.

results.title: Anna Karenina
results.creator_credit: Julien Duvivier, Alexander Korda and London Film Productions
results.brief_description: Produced in England and released in the US by 20th Century Fox, this handsomely mounted but stolid adaptation of Tolstoy’s classic novel stars Vivien Leigh in the title role as a 19th century Russian gentlewoman who leaves her bureaucrat husband (Ralph Richardson) for a dashing army officer (Kieron Moore).

results.title: Hobson's choice
results.creator_credit: David Lean and British Lion Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on Harold Brighouse’s 1915 play, this working-class comedy is set in nineteenth century Salford. Henry Hobson (Charles Laughton) is a drunken Lancashire bootmaker who tyrannises his staff and his three daughters. After refusing to allow his daughters to marry because of the expense involved, he is bought to heel by the eldest (Brenda de Banzie) who rebels against her father’s rule to marry his assistant (John Mills). Together with her new husband she sets up a rival boot shop. Lean’s film won the BFI ‘best film’ award in 1954. With Prunella Scales.

results.title: Romance (E)
results.creator_credit: Catherine Breillat, Jean-Francois Lepetit, Canal+, Arte, CB Films (France) and Flach Film
results.brief_description: ‘Romance’ is a sexually explicit film that is more concerned with the psychological implications of sex than the physical act itself. Marie (Caroline Ducey), a young primary school teacher, is deeply disturbed by her narcissistic male model boyfriend’s behavior, who refuses to show her any kind of physical affection, much less make love to her. In an attempt to find a balance between the physical and emotional aspects of love, Marie embarks on a succession of brief encounters of the purely carnal kind with Paolo (played by Italian porn star Rocco Stiffredi), the ultimate latin lover, and Robert (Francois Berleand), an older man, who initiates her to S&M games. Although the film has its source in the French tradition of sexually charged writing that stretches from De Sade to de Beauvoir, Bataille, and Foucault, ‘Romance’ fast became a ‘success de scandale’ for its explicit showing of sex. The film was originally refused classification (ie: banned) in Australia by the Office of Film and Literature Classification for contravening the guidelines of an ‘R’ rating. This decision was later overturned by the Classification Review Board, thus re-igniting (albeit, briefly) the debate of censorship and public morality in Australia. Cast includes Thomas Sagamore Stevenin. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Star maker = L'Uomo Delle Stelle
results.creator_credit: Giuseppe Tornatore, Vittorio Cecchi Gori, Summit Entertainment and Checci Gori Group
results.brief_description: From Guiseppe Tornatore, director of “Cinema Paradiso”, this is a story drenched in the filmmaker’s love for cinema. Set in Sicily in the early 1950s, it is the story of Joe Morelli (Sergio Castellitto), a con man who travels by truck from village to village posing as a film company representative. For a fee, he offers his victims screen tests, using passages from a script of “0

results.title: Letter for an angel = Surat untuk bidadari (D)
results.creator_credit: Garin Nugroho, Budiyati Abiyoga and Prasidi Teta Film
results.brief_description: Set in a remote village in Nusa Tenggara, this haunting film follows the story of a young boy, Lewa. Smitten by Lewa’s surrogate mother, a local honcho kills Lewa’s father in order to marry her. One by one, the people around Lewa are taken away from him, in response he writes to an ‘angel’, seeking answers to the events that have befallen him. The film showcases the Sumba culture, with traditional ceremonies shot in a documentary style, including scenes of real animal sacrifices which are quite explicit (do not expect a ‘no animals were harmed’ disclaimer at the end as the scenes are not staged). Garin Nugroho’s second feature was awarded Best Film at the Taormina Film Festival in Italy and Gold Prize at the Young Cinema Competition, Tokyo International Film Festival 1994. Cast includes Nurul Arifin, Adi Kurdi and Jajang Pamontjak. In Bahasa Indonesia with English subtitles.

results.title: Love on a slice of bread = Cinta dalam sepotong roti
results.creator_credit: Garin Nugroho, Budiyati Abiyoga and Prasidi Teta Film
results.brief_description: Director Garin Nugroho’s first feature is the story of three childhood friends caught in a love triangle. Topan, a photographer, visits his childhood friends who have married each other. The three of them end up travelling to Lombok together, which proves to be not such a good idea. The husband is revealed to be sexually incompetent and he ends up having an affair with Topan’s photographic model (although to what extent remains unclear as the film was censored by the Indonesian Censorship Board). Meanwhile, Mayang finds out that she has more in common with Topan than her husband. This is arguably Nugroho’s most mainstream effort. Later on, he went on to develop his hallmark strengths - intricate cultural nuances, sparse dialogue and a sense of hightened realism. This film won Best Film at the Indonesian Film Festival in 1991 and Best young Director at the Asia-Pacific Film Festival in South Korea in the same year. In Bahasa Indonesia with English subtitles.

results.title: Manon des Sources [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Claude Berri, Gerard Brach and Renn Productions
results.brief_description: Second and concluding part of the story based on the novel by Marcel Pagnol that began with “Jean de Florette”. This part, taking place ten years later, deals with the revenge inflicted by Jean’s daughter on those responsible for his death. An absorbing tale that makes its leisurely way to an unexpected climax. Cast includes Daniel Auteuil, Yves Montand and Emmanuelle Beart.

results.title: Love lessons = Lust och Fagring Stor
results.creator_credit: Bo Widerberg, Per Holst, Svenska filminstitutet, Nordisk Films Kompagni and Danske Filminstitut
results.brief_description: Set in 1943 in Malmo (Sweden) ‘Love Lessons’ follows the sexual awakening of Stig (Johan Widerberg, the director’s son), a 15 year old student, with his teacher Viola (Marika Lagercrantz), 22 year his senior. At the beginning of the school year Stig is just one more adolescent, as ignorant as he is curious about women and sex. He develops an immediate crush on his new teacher, Viola, who is unhappily married to an alcoholic travelling salesman. Breaking every ethical code, Viola spends every afternoon giving Stig love lessons, until the day the young man meets Viola’s husband and becomes sympathetic to his plight. Sharing his time between a demanding lover and an unexpected friend, Stig’s life becomes even more complex when the young girl living next door directs her affection towards him. Feeling Stig’s love waning, Viola extracts a petty revenge on him, perhaps teaching the young man the ultimate love lesson: “hell hath no fury like a woman’s scorn”. Winner of the Silver Bear award at the Berlin Film Festival 1995. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: Moon warriors [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Samo Hung and Team Work Production House
results.brief_description: Simple fisherman Fei (Andy Lau) finds himself caught up in an extraordinary situation after assisting fugitive Prince (Kenny Bee) and his bodyguard Hsien (Maggie Cheung) after they have been ambushed in the forest near his home. Unaware of their identities at first, he invites them to take refuge in his village, where he learns of the conflict that has driven the Prince into fleeing his ancestral home. The Prince, appreciative of Fei’s skill with a sword, asks him to accompany Hsien on a mission to rescue his betrothed, Princess Yuen (Anita Mui), and her father, the Emperor Lan-Ning Kwan. When they reach the Emperor and his daughter, they are confronted by a calculated surprise attack that leaves almost everyone except dead. A tangled web begins to unravel amidst the chaos, uncovering the devastating truth. An epic, atmospheric tale of rivalry, betrayal and revenge from legendary director Samo Hung, internationally renowned for creating original and aggressively acrobatic fight scenes in Hong Kong action films. In Cantonese with English subtitles.
